pageContent: Purpose: Prostatic intraepithelial neoplasia (PIN) is often considered to be a premalignant lesion and the main precursor of invasive carcinoma of the prostate. We evaluated the evidence for and against PIN as a premalignant lesion and determined guidelines for the clinical management of PIN.

metaData.source:
Active surveillance for prostate cancer: an underutilized opportunity for reducing harm
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/23271770/
